section: This Services Agreement (this "Agreement") is entered into on October 1, 2019 and is made effective as of November 1, 2019 (the "Effective Date")
explanation: The contract states it is 'entered into' on October 1, 2019, but its 'Effective Date' is November 1, 2019. This presents a discrepancy because the agreement is technically created on the former date but only becomes operational on the latter. This could cause confusion regarding the period between these dates.

section: Each of the Recipient and the Provider may, in their sole discretion, terminate this Agreement in whole or in part, at any time without cause, and without liability except, in the case of the Recipient, for required payment for services rendered and reimbursement for authorized expenses incurred, by providing at least 30 (thirty) days' prior written notice to the other party (such date, the "Services Termination Date").
explanation: This termination clause permits either party to terminate the agreement "in whole or in part" without cause, subject to 30 days' notice. However, the implications of partial termination (i.e., terminating only specific Services) are not clearly defined. This ambiguity could result in disputes over which specific aspects of the agreement remain in effect following a partial termination.

section: This Agreement and any claim, controversy or dispute arising out of or related to this Agreement, any of the transactions contemplated hereby and/or the interpretation and enforcement of the rights and duties of the Parties, whether arising in contract, tort, equity or otherwise, shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the domestic laws of the State of Israel (including in respect of the statute of limitations or other limitations period applicable to any such claim, controversy or dispute), without giving effect to any choice or conflict of law provision or rule (whether of the State of Israel or any other jurisdiction) that would cause the application of the laws of any jurisdiction other than the State of Israel.
explanation: The section specifies that Israeli law governs the agreement, including its statute of limitations. However, enforcing Israeli statutes of limitations in jurisdictions outside of Israel can pose practical challenges and may conflict with local procedural rules. This presents a potential legal contradiction because while the agreement stipulates Israeli law, the application of specific aspects of that law may be limited or altered by the legal system where enforcement is sought.
